edges.to: significant market responsiveness in graphite markets
edges.mechanism: market adjustment to changed demand conditions
edges.evidence: The data suggests that graphite markets exhibit significant responsiveness to both demand shocks (financial crisis) and supply shocks (export restrictions)

edges.to: significant market responsiveness in graphite markets
edges.mechanism: market adjustment to constrained supply conditions
edges.evidence: The data suggests that graphite markets exhibit significant responsiveness to both demand shocks (financial crisis) and supply shocks (export restrictions)

edges.from: China implementing export quotas on rare earth elements and other critical minerals, including graphite
edges.to: export quotas reduced by 30-40% compared to 2009 levels
edges.mechanism: direct policy implementation setting quantitative limits on exports
edges.evidence: In 2010, China implemented significant export quotas on rare earth elements and other critical minerals, including graphite. Key policy measures included: - Export quotas reduced by 30-40% compared to 2009 levels

edges.from: China implementing export restrictions on critical minerals including graphite
edges.to: licensing requirements tightened for mineral exports
edges.mechanism: policy implementation establishing stricter administrative controls on export permissions
edges.evidence: In 2010, China implemented significant export quotas on rare earth elements and other critical minerals, including graphite. Key policy measures included: - Licensing requirements tightened for mineral exports

edges.from: China implementing export restrictions on critical minerals including graphite
edges.to: environmental compliance standards raised for mining operations
edges.mechanism: policy implementation establishing higher regulatory requirements for mining activities
edges.evidence: In 2010, China implemented significant export quotas on rare earth elements and other critical minerals, including graphite. Key policy measures included: - Environmental compliance standards raised for mining operations

edges.from: strong industrial demand from steel and automotive sectors
edges.to: natural graphite imports to the United States increased significantly in 2008
edges.mechanism: increased demand from key industrial sectors drives higher import volumes to meet consumption needs
edges.evidence: Natural graphite imports to the United States increased significantly in 2008, reaching approximately 53 million USD, up from a baseline of 32-37 million USD in prior years. This increase was driven by several factors: 1. Strong industrial demand from steel and automotive sectors

edges.to: natural graphite imports to the United States increased significantly in 2008
edges.mechanism: insufficient domestic supply capacity forces reliance on foreign sources to meet demand
edges.evidence: Natural graphite imports to the United States increased significantly in 2008, reaching approximately 53 million USD, up from a baseline of 32-37 million USD in prior years. This increase was driven by several factors: 2. Limited domestic production capacity

edges.from: growing dependence on imports from China and other suppliers
edges.to: natural graphite imports to the United States increased significantly in 2008
edges.mechanism: increased reliance on foreign suppliers directly translates to higher import volumes
edges.evidence: Natural graphite imports to the United States increased significantly in 2008, reaching approximately 53 million USD, up from a baseline of 32-37 million USD in prior years. This increase was driven by several factors: 3. Growing dependence on imports from China and other suppliers
